intro: Berteroa thessala, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and feathery leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Berteroa thessala is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and resilience.
